CONVERSATION GROUP: BK revised "But... you probably want to talk about what we're about to do."
BK tweaked "I have no idea what to do. Other than beating up the demon, that is. I assume that's a given."
BK revised "I expect a tour of Longsaddle when we get done here."

BK was "You're very confident, aren't you? I wish I were do sure. I've changed my pants several times since we've been here, you know? Figuratively, I mean. There really isn't anywhere to change in the Astral Plane."
BK was "Don't worry, I'll mention you in my menoirs. Though I'll probably leave out that derro, and I'll probably mak Larethar an elf."
BK was "I knew you would ask me that. On one hand, demon apocalypses are bad, so we should try to stop it. On the other hand...."
BK was "I cannot put my faith in your gods. We cannot risk your plan not working."
BK was "I make that choice under protest. "
BK was "Of course. You have that right. I hope only that when the time comes, you see clearly  and allow me to do what must be done."
BK was "It has been a long, strange journey, my friend. When we met under threat of a mercenary attack, I never thought it would be so difficult to say goodbye to you. "
BK was "The "magic stone" will call to more people like you and me. It will inspired generations toward righteousness, kindness, and beauty. That is far more than one "person like me" could ever do."
BK gravity just seemed too modern. line was "You understand the gravity of what we're doing. Something not even my dear Larethar can ever do."
BK tweaked "If so, it is only because you destroyed that which I hold most dear. I promise you, it would be the end of our adventures together."
BK edited from "And I, you, my friend and companion. You have made a hero of Larethar, and brought me to the place where I might meet my destiny at last."
BK was "She took a rat like me and gave him something to live for. Before her, it was wall-to-wall drinks, women, and bad ideas. If she's gone... what's the bloody point?"

BK revised from "That elf woman over there is the best thing that ever happened to me. Friend or lover, cleric or angel, she's the one thing making me more than just another drunken dwarf, pinching arses and stinking up the place."
BK was "I'm a dog in a good man's clothes. I always will be. And when Lydie's gone, those clothes are coming off."
BK cut " in our quest" because I think Dalanir was trying to say that he has improved in a general sense... not just specific to this occasion.
BK was "Tasyllys is no longer my brother. He is a demon's plaything, driven mad with revenge and a desire for destruction and death."
BK was "I should take a moment to myself, go over my spells, and try to remember everything I know about demons. Speak with our friends. I will be there when the time comes."
BK revised from "And now we are here. Allies against the demon itself. And I now believe you to be righteous in your quest. I do not sense betrayal on your mind."
Bk revised from "Say what you will, knight. Nothing you say can make up for what you've done."

I have done and will do terrible things in my quest to see that no demon or devil gains a hold on this world. But today, our course is clear. Evil will stand before us to be judged, and we will pass judgment.
Was: "Destroying the Moontear will deal the demon a powerful blow. One that will allow us to banish Belaphoss for a century or more."
BK was: Then you place the world in jeopardy on one woman's faith. I have seen more foolish decisions, but never in a situation this dire.
BK Step through the door and face your destiny?
